title: MLB.TV: Verify if we are logged into a valid MLB.com Account that has MLB.TV access that tapping on the TV icon on the navigation bar will open up the available games and selecting one will launch that particular game successfully
custom_preconds: Given we have a valid MLB.com Account that has MLB.TV access
custom_steps:
When we tap on the TV icon on the Navigation Bar
And we tap on a game
And we tap on a feed
custom_expected: Then that particular game will begin to play successfully

title: MLB.TV: Verify if we are logged into a valid MLB.com Account that has MLB.TV access that a user is able to stream a live game when there is one available utilizing that games home or away feeds depending on what is available
custom_preconds:
Given we have a logged into a valid MLB.com Account that has MLB.TV
And we have selected the TV button in the Navigation Bar
custom_steps:
When we tap on a Home Stream
Or we tap on an Away Stream
custom_expected: Then the live video begins to play successfully

title: MLB.TV: Verify while we are streaming a live game that all the overlays function correctly
custom_preconds: Given we have started up a Live Game Stream
custom_steps: When we tap the various overlays
custom_expected: Then all the overlays function correctly

title: MLB.TV: Verify a at bat entitled user is able to stream the Free Game of the Day
custom_preconds: Given the user is an at bat entitled user
custom_steps: When we attempt to stream the Free Game of the Day
custom_expected: Then we are successful

title: MLB.TV: Verify if a user is in a location where a particular game is being blacked out that the game can't be streamed by that user
custom_preconds: Given that we have set the location of our device to the locale of a game that can be blacked out
custom_steps: When we attempt to start up that games feed
custom_expected: Then we will receive a message that that particular game is currently blacked out for the user

title: MLB.TV: Verify when a user is utilizing a premium MLB.TV account that both the Home and Away feeds are available to them
custom_preconds: Given the user is currently utilizing a premium MLB.TV account
custom_steps: When we attempt to pull up the feeds for a game
custom_expected:
Then the Home feed will be available for the user to utilize
And the Away feed will be available for the user to utilize

title: MLB.TV: Verify that we are able to stream MLB.TV over a WiFi connection and that the quality is better then what we would see on a carrier network
custom_preconds: Given we are utilizing a WiFi connection at the moment
custom_steps: When we attempt to start up MLB.TV
custom_expected: Then we are able to successfully stream MLB.TV at a great quality

title: MLB.TV: Verify that if we are utilizing a Carrier Network that we are able to stream MLB.TV successfully
custom_preconds: Given we are currently utilizing a Carrier Network
custom_steps: When we attempt to start up an MLB.TV strema
custom_expected: Then the stream begins to play successfully over the Carrier Network

title: MLB.TV [IAB-3485]: Verify that the Video Player will successfully start up at the Live part of the game consistently
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we have an MLB.TV Stream that is LIVE
AND we start up this particular stream
custom_expected: THEN it will successfully begin at the Live part of the game consistently

title: MLB.TV [IAB-4360]: Verify that we do not encounter an 'Access Issue' when trying to access the 'Free Game of the Day' for the first time through the Paywall Subscriber Login
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
AND we aren't logged in as an Entitled MLB.TV user
custom_steps:
WHEN we tap on a 'Free Game of the Day' link
AND we log in with the credentials of: (mlbtvtest+7@gmail.com / tester)
custom_expected: THEN we will not have any issues accessing the 'Free Game of the Day' feed

title: MLB.TV [IAB-4420]: Verify that an App Entitled user who is watching a 'Free Game of the Day' and attempts to access a Paid Feed through MLB.TV is hit with a Paywall
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
AND we are utilizing an App Entitled Account
custom_steps:
WHEN we start up a 'Free Game of the Day'
AND we attempt to access a paid feed through the MLB.TV interface
custom_expected: THEN we will encounter a Paywall

title: MLB.TV [IAB-4447]: Verify that we can successfully see in-game commercial scores
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we start up an MLB.TV Stream
AND there are in-game commercials available
custom_expected:
THEN we are able to see the transition to the in-game commercials successfully
AND we are able to see the in-game commercials transition back to the game successfully

title: MLB.TV [IAB-4727]: Verify if an App Entitled user selects the 'Free Game of the Day' feed and then attempts to utilize the overlay to switch to a non 'Free' archive that they aren't able to
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
AND we have multiple archive games available
AND at least one of those archive games is a 'Free Game of the Day'
AND we are utilizing just an App-Entitled user
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to the MLB.TV grid
AND we navigate to the 'Free Game of the Day' archive
AND we start up that particular archive
AND while inside the Media Player we tap on a non 'Free Game of the Day' archive
custom_expected: THEN we will NOT be able to access any of the non-'Free Game of the Day' archives

title: MLB.TV [IAB-4736]: Verify that the 'Play Ball!' screen is formatted correctly and doesn't appear to cut anything off
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to the MLB.TV grid
AND we start up an archived game
OR we start up a live game
custom_expected:
THEN the 'Play Ball!' screen that appears will be formatted correctly
AND the 'Play Ball!' screen will not appear to cut anything off

title: MLB.TV [IAB-4920]: Verify that the national blackout text reads correctly at the moment
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we tap on the MLB.TV menu item
AND we start up a MLB.TV Stream that has a "National Blackout" against it
custom_expected:
THEN the "National Blackout" text will read as:

Due to MLB exclusivities, live national broadcasts of MLB events, such as the All-Star Game, and live national broadcasts of MLB games occurring each Saturday with a scheduled start time after 1:10 PM ET or before 8:00 PM ET and each Sunday with a scheduled start time after 5:00 PM ET will be blacked out in the U.S. (including Guam and the U.S. Virgin Islands). In the event of circumstances that produce a programming conflict or change in schedule, the above blackout windows may be subject to change. Live audio broadcast as well as on-demand viewing following the conclusion of the game or event may be available as part of an MLB.TV or At Bat 12 subscription.

title: MLB.TV [IAB-4926]: Verify that when we start up an MLB.TV Archive Feed that the Scrubber works correctly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we navigate to MLB.TV
AND we select an Archived Game
AND we start up one of the Archived Game Feeds
AND we attempt to pull the scrubber around
custom_expected: THEN we will be able to utilize the scrubber successfully.

title: MLB.TV [IAB-4934]: Verify that if we are on a day with "No Video's Available" that we do not see the MLB.TV upsell link
custom_preconds:
GIVEN we have installed At Bat
AND we have launched the Application
AND we are utilizing the Lite version of the Application
custom_steps:
WHEN we tap on the MLB.TV icon in the top right corner
AND we navigate to a day that has "No Video Available"
custom_expected: THEN we will not see the MLB.TV upsell link present

title: MLB.TV [IAB-6255]: Verify that the app doesn't crash when launching an Archive where Blackout Restrictions haven't been removed
custom_preconds:
Given the user is logged in with an MLB.tv entitled account
And there is a MLB.tv stream with a state of "Archive"
And the blackout restrictions have NOT been removed (example: MLB_HOME_TEAM_BLACKOUTMLB_AWAY_TEAM_BLACKOUT)
custom_steps:
When the user launches the stream
And the app performs the blackout check
custom_expected:
Then the user will be blacked out of the Archive
And the app will NOT crash

title: Closed Captioning: User toggles on CC
custom_preconds:
Given there is a game in a "Live" state with Closed Captioning
And the user launches the Live stream
custom_steps: When the user toggles the CC button to an "On" state on the video control overlay
custom_expected:
Then closed captioning will display on the Live MLB.tv stream
And the CC button will be illuminated in blue

title: Closed Captioning: User toggles off CC
custom_preconds:
Given there is a game in a "Live" state with Closed Captioning
And the user launches the Live stream
And Closed Captioning has been previously enabled by the user
custom_steps: When the user toggles the CC button to an "Off" state
custom_expected:
Then closed captioning will STOP display on the Live MLB.tv stream
And the CC button will no longer be illuminated in blue

title: Closed Captioning: Setting is retained
custom_preconds:
Given there are two or more games in a "Live" state with Closed Captioning
And the user launches one of the Live streams
custom_steps:
When the user toggles the CC button to an "On" state on the video control overlay
And dismisses the Video player
And launches another Live stream
custom_expected:
Then closed captioning will display on the Live MLB.tv stream
And the CC button will be illuminated in blue

title: Closed Captioning: CC button
custom_preconds:
Given there is a game in a "Live" state
And the user launches the Live stream
custom_steps: When the video controls overlay is displaying
custom_expected: Then Closed Captioning button will be properly aligned with the overlays button

title: Closed Captioning: CC works over AirPlay
custom_preconds:
Given there is a game in a "Live" state with Closed Captioning
And the user launches the Live stream
And the user has enabled AirPlay
custom_steps: When the user toggles the CC button to an "On" state on the video control overlay
custom_expected:
Then closed captioning will display on the Live MLB.tv stream
And the CC button will be illuminated in blue
